title: Roasted Garlic Bhel Mix | Spicy Puffed rice Mix | Chatpata Snack
content:
Snack recipe: Roasted Garlic Murmura mix Servings: 4 Duration: 10 mins In my view, Murmura Mix is my all time favorite and easy to make. I previously shared Murmura Chivda with different spices and this is another version of Bhel. I'm sure You can taste the difference if you have tried my previousÂ Murmura/Puffed Rice Chivda MixÂ and if not tried you can go with this new twist Roasted Garlic Bhel Mix, it's a perfect Evening snack / Â pack in tour/ for kids I used Kashmiri Red chilly powder it has great essence and lovely natural red color and it's not too spicy, so that you can include in your food especially for kids ğŸ™‚ğŸ‘ Checkout this linkÂ for homemade Kashmiri red chilly powder ..I hope you like it, Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Fresh & crunchy - Puffed rice/ Murmura - 150 gms
  • Garlic cloves - 3 medium sized
  • Dry roasted peanuts - 80 gms
  • Roasted Chana dal/ Pappulu - 60 gms
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Kashmiri Red chilly powder - 2 tb sp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Oil - 30 ml
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 10
Procedure:
  • Dry roast/ Saute Murmura in a big deep frying pan over low to medium heat
  • Saute about 8 mins or till they become crisp ( don't burn Murmura or don't turn them into brown color )
  • In a coffee blender add salt, red chilly powder, turmeric powder, garlic cloves
  • Blend till smooth paste
  • Heat a big sized skillet pan over medium heat
  • Add oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds & curry leaves
  • Saute and add roasted chickpea, peanuts & grounded paste
  • Saute 2 mins on low to medium heat
  • Turn off heat
  • Let it become cool down and then add Murmura
  • Mix well with hand because it works out well and spices applies equally on them
  • Store in airtight container to remain fresh & crisp
  • Happy cooking ğŸ‘©ğŸ»â€ğŸ³ & have a lovely day â˜€ï¸
